title: Must see church. 6-7 minutes from train station.
text: This church, along with 3 others once served as the seat of papacy. If you are a history buff of church history, this is a must see. Typical os interiors of the era, the outside facade does not tell what lies inside. It is also a 10 minute walk from the Forum Romano.

title: Good rental Company
text: Picked up and returned car at airport. Fast efficient check in and out. Good car. We should note we were there before the terrorist attacks in 2019 so security may be stepped up. They take it very seriously. Have all your papers and passport in order.

title: World Famous site
text: Those who have studied Western Civilization in school know that this site is a must see. Big crowds, even in winter. Has a lift for handicapped (scary!) but if you are wheel chair bound, it would be difficult going at the top.

title: This is the hotel for Athens
text: This hotel has very nice rooms, excellent breakfast and employees that are very happy to help in any way for reservations, directions and sightseeing. A BIG plus is that it is about 150 meters from the Monostracki metro stop and is on a direct route from the airport train to Monostracki station. The square is a center of activity. The hotel is a 20 minute walk, all uphill, to the Parthenon but there are sights to see along the way. Easy walking distance to the Plaka center.

title: Beautiful inside.
text: My objection to entering a church is paying to get inside, you have to pay. The gold used to cover the interior is amazing. Plus there are 100 knight tombs in the floor.

title: The place to stay in Valetta
text: This is a boutique hotel in the heart of the Old Town but not too far to drag your luggage. Nice breakfast and rooms and helpful staff. They seem to be obsessed with paintings and sketches of a naked model that some border on porno. But that is a boutique statement.

title: Good Hotel, but Isolated
text: Because of a tight flight connection, we were forced to stay near the airport. This Holiday Inn is a business hotel catering to businessmen and meetings. It is isolated and a distance from the airport. It has a shuttle available. There are no sights or activities nearby. Use it as a way station for flights.
place: Holiday Inn Athens Attica Avenue Airport West

title: Must See
text: Most do not realize it is a church but the star of the building is that roof. Don't miss the marble floor. After wandering about inside, go outside and have a beverage at a surrounding cafe.

title: Good Hotel, Good location
text: Conveniently located a 100 meters from the main train station, the hotel is also well located for walking to explore the city. Breakfast is good, the room was clean and modern and all but one clerk was very helpful.

title: Poorly Prepared Food
text: Ordered a Chicken Marsala Dinner. Salad contained cheap, limp head lettuce with mostly white cuttings and the garlic dressing had hardly any garlic taste.. The Chicken Marsala chicken breast had been fried some time ago and was reheated to only a warm temp and soggy breading. Had very little Marsala sauce. The spaghetti was not hot and the cheese topping was tasteless. The restaurant was almost empty but it took 10 minutes to seat us.

title: Well prepared food and atmosphere
text: Went there for dinner with my wife. You have to watch for the sign as the restaurant iss hidden off the road. Absolutely great food. The enclosed outdoor setting had a nice ambiance. The woner says it is a family affair. He cooks his specialty items, his brother does his and their father cooks his. Large portions. Could not finish the entire plate. They called a tuk tuk for us and set the return price for us, to good advantage. Since we own a food service operation, we were able to speak at some length about their operation. Nice, friendly folks. Recommend highly.

title: Fresh Seafood cooked to order
text: The setting could not be better. Picture a small table for two under a wood trellis on the beach with mood lighting and stars over the ocean. Add to that really fresh seafood and service. I ordered baked fish. It was so large, I could only eat half and the chef came out, very concerned, to ask what was wrong as I did not eat the whole fish. About a 6-8 minute tuk tuk from our hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel on the beach
text: This is a luxury hotel. It has luxury rooms, full breakfast and is on the Indian Ocean with a beachfront and a pool. Classy hotel and worth the splurge. Two small drawbacks, a tuk tuk ride to Galle old town is about 30 minutes but an interesting ride with sights to see along the way. Second, the Wifi is sporadic on the higher floors. Secure property with 24 our security. Some really good restaurants nearby. Surfing on the beach front also. Service and attention is first rate. Also interesting to see is that there are daily wedding receptions and ceremonies at the hotel. To see a Sri Lankan wedding with full floral decorations is very interesting.

title: Good Service, dirty car
text: Rented a car for 6 days with airport pickup and drop. It was a well used car, as we expected. Sign up and rep contact good. The car had 12+ dings and scratches, all noted on the inspection report. Car was dirty inside and out. Papers and food debris left from previous rentals. We had a flat tire and when we had it repaired, we discovered that the tire had been flat before and a previous renter had an inner tube put in to get by. Well, it gave out on us. We bought a used tire for $20 and had it put back on the vehicle with no further problems. Return went smoothly. We had to place a 40,000 rupee ($220)deposit in addition to the rental fee. We waited a week after we got back and it was not credited back on our charge card. After several emails, the credit did go thru minus the extra mileage, which we were expecting. Would use the company again but would like an unlimited mileage option, as we sight see by car for scenery and travel that interests us.

title: 16 hour flight, testy cabin attendants
text: This is a looong flight, 16 hours there and 17 back. No way around it, just have to suffer thru it. But on the way back, the situation was not helped by the attitude of the cabin crew. Being a"senior" my self, I noticed the crew was also senior aged. They had no patience with passengers, giving them dirty looks or approving glances whenever they were annoyed. A senior aged man was the most annoyed. Never saw a cabin attendant that age before, probably 60-65.

title: Late flights many gate changes
text: We took 5 internal flights within India, all with Jet Airways. There were about 3 gates changes with each flight, with no announcements. Most flights were late. One flight we had actually parked at a gate, engines off, then the pilot says that the plane has to channge gates, so we were towed over to another gate. One flight has 3 of the seats around us in poor repair and there was heavy engine exhaust soot buildup on the entire wing trailing edge. It appears it had not been serviced in weeks. Never again.

title: Well preserved fort and grounds
text: The ancient fort is a short tuk tuk ride from our Royalton Hotel. It is a fascinating walk around the fort. Allow a half day to see it. Best seen in the morning to avoid the bus tours.

title: The place to see people
text: This is the center attraction for the city and is full of vendors, touts and people of all religions and ethnic groups. It is a must see.

title: Excellent hotel, service and food for tourists
text: Stayed here 3 days and it was an excellent time. Good clean room, bed and good buffet breakfast. We ate dinner there once and was very tasty. The only drawback for tourists is that it is about a half hour tuk tuk ride to the Chaminar and central sights. The tuk tuk ride is better than a Disney ride. Has luggage screening and metal detector to get in. Good security.

title: Top luxury hotel overlooking Kandy
text: This hotel is a luxury facility located on a hill slope above the city. Rooms are spacious and the food is Excellent with mostly Sri Lankan specialties. Breakfast is a combo of continental and Sri Lankan selections. Monkeys climb all over the outside of the facility and on our room balcony.

title: Nice walk along fort and thru town
text: We walked along the ramparts of the old fort and around the town. The walk was very interesting and if you stand and look closely, you can see all sorts of fish and marine life in the water below. The town is very quaint and full of interesting shops and small eating places.
place: Old Town of Galle and its Fortifications

title: Good local fair
text: We had Sri Lankan rice dishes and they were very tasty. Lots of atmosphere while watching traffic and people go by. Good value and service

title: Business hotel, long way from airport
text: This hotel is a fairly high security business hotel. Rooms are clean and the included breakfast is prepared to order, not a buffet. A 24 hour guard must access the elevator and you can only access the floor your are living on. It is hard to find. We stayed there twice in the same trip and both times the taxi driver could not find readily find it. After we left by tuk tuk for a restaurant, the driver could not spot it either. It is iver an hour to the airport. Pay by cash, charge card, US money or Sri Lankan.

title: Good food, nice ambiance
text: Our food was top notch and the service was very good. Seemed to be very popular with tourists and locals alike.

title: poorly prepared food
text: Just a few steps from La Vie Woods hotel, this restaurant specializes in seafood. Our fresh Calimari was like a greasy rubber band and the fish and chips were so over fried that the filet could have been used to resole my shoe. After reading previous glowing comments, I am baffled at the quality of uor food. We were the only customers at the time, so there should not have been a cooking problem.

title: Cottage hotel near Goa Beaches
text: Guests have individual cottages with A/C, Wifi and nice room. The common area has a pool and breakfast is served buffet style there. Breakfast is all veggie but is excellent and omelettes are made to order. Staff is very friendly and helpful

title: Average tour site
text: Getting to here by taxi took over an hour. It seems that there are 14 million vehicles in Mumbai and only 4 million parking spots, so the other 10 mil must keep moving, all in your direction. Worse at night. For us, it was just a large arch with dozens of hucksters and touts. Go to the Colaba market from here and get a real view of a local market.

title: Great hotel near airport
text: This is a business hotel, high quality, but serves tourists like us very well. Rooms were excellent and the breakfast was top notch with continental and Indian foods. Omelets were prepared to order. Dinner was essentially Indian. Has security also. You must pass thru metal detector when entering hotel. Taxis right outside door. One little hiccup, the hotel is apparently hard to find by the prepaid taxi service at the airport. We stayed there for the first night and the last night of our holiday. The first time, the taxi took us to the Kohinoor Elite at first. The second time it took 6 drivers at the airport to huddle and decide where it was and the driver still got it wrong. If you use the prepaid taxi, be sure to tell them "Kohinoor Continental.

title: Great Seafood
text: Had baked oysters and fish and chips. Both were prepared well and very tasty. We used service at the bar and the bartender was attentive and refilled drinks quickly. Convenient to area motels.

title: BBQ Redux
text: Back for another dinner and review a year later. This time we had the loaded baked potato with pulled pork, thinking it would be a light meal. It was the grandmother of all potatoes, humongous and tasty. Shared it with my wife. Recommend it, but do not order anything else unless you eat like a lumberjack.

title: Ordered Apps for a light meal.
text: Ordered potato skins and a artichoke spinach dip for a light meal after a long work day. The skins were good but we have had better artichoke spinach dip at other chains.

title: Nice steak and trimings
text: Had a sirloin and was cookes to order. Ordered the onion petals but they were probably frozen and battered too heavily. Stick with the blossom as it has to be cooked fresh.

title: Tasty Mexican style food and good service.
text: Good food for a chain and the service was excellent. A surprise was a go home bag of chips and salsa at no extra cost. Typically a wait at peak dining times, like a typical chain restaurant.

title: Good burgers
text: Typical 5 Guys restaurant. Properly cooked food and service. Had a burger and fries. Location hidden in a long strip center off the main hwy.

title: Bada Book, Bad Boom not working here
text: Room had broken furniture, holes in plaster. Room was not serviced everyday, had to ask. Breakfast food was consistently cold for our 7 day stay. Clerk was annoyed when we asked to have coffee and food refilled.

title: Best service, good food
text: Very good food and service here. Had calamari app and a linguini chicken dish that was very tasty. Located near the NO airport and convenient to exways for downtown NO, about 10 minutes away.

title: Slow service, poorly prepared food
text: Unlike the Carrabba's in New Orleans, this franchise left much to be desired. Will not return. We arrived at 6 pm.m. on a Tuesday, the restaurant was less than half full, with a party of 7. Drinks were served quickly but we waited 35 minutes or salads and longer for a single soup. The entrees took 65 minutes to arrive. Dishes throughout the table were poorly cooked, watery and little flavor. Fooled me once but won't twice.

title: Mislieading free breakfast
text: The hotel, room and amenities were fine The problem is the free breakfast. An English muffin and a A cup of coffee is not what we expected when the hotel offers "free breakfast." An IHOP is attached to the hotel and you have to go in there for the "free" breakfast. If you want what most other hotels offer for a free breakfast, you pay the menu price at IHOP. Would not have stayed there if this was known.
place: Ramada by Wyndham Metairie New Orleans Airport

title: Warm, Great room
text: The room was a warm friendly space with attention to small details that are appreciated in a New Zealand Motel. Full kitchen and appliances and service ware. Just like home. Thanks to Shona and Peter Therredge for a warm welcome.

title: Perfect Stay!
text: We wanted to stay out of Nelson traffic before crossing back to the North island on the ferry and decided to travel up the coast to Motueka. The Avalon was a nice surprise with very large ultra clean rooms with all the little thoughtful conveniences for home cooking. On the main street with the main downtown area of this small town just a 100 meters or so away, it was a perfect spot and the hosts were very helpful.

title: Great Pastry!
text: We had several pastries including croissants both plain and chocolate filled. Nice selection. Good coffee. Conveniently located amoung the motels and businesses.

title: A slightly Hidden Gem
text: Located 1 door off the main street, the host Con was very helpful and eager to make sure we were settled in our very nice room. We were in a stop iover from Wellinton to Aujland and found this late in the day. The room was very comfortable and clean with all the typical things in a New Zealand motel.

title: Near CBD and good Asian Restaurants
text: The Quest is not strictly a hotel, it is apartments that are rented as hotel rooms. We had an issue with bathroom cleanliness and after discussing it with the staff, we still disagreed but overall the room was excellent. Unusual was the security. You have an elevator key fob that has to activate the elevator and you can only go to your floor. The Wifi code is coded to you and your room. The included breakfast was pretty chintsy with a minimal continental choice available without paying for extras. For the rating, we would call it a luxury hotel but Aukland prices would only rate it as a mid range price. The hotel is on a fairly;y steep hill going downward to the city center. If you use the Skybus from the airport, there is a stop just above the hotel, so the short walk is downhill. Then when using the Skybus to go back to the airport, there is another station just 100 meters downhill from the hotel. No uphill toting your luggage.

title: Authentic Vietnamese food
text: We had several dishes over 2 sittings and were pleased with all. The hosts were very gracious and pointed out specialties. If it is any indication of the ethnic quality of the food, the restaurant was full of customers, mainly other Vietnamese folks.
place: Ha Noi Corner Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine

title: Very Convenient, central city stops
text: Very convenient pickup and drop off from the airport and back. 1/3 the price of a taxi. Buses stop at various city points every 10-15 minutes. There is a schule booklet available anywhere the bus stops.

title: On a Clear Day you can see forever
text: To get your ticket to ride, go in the hotel at the base of the tower and take the escatlator to the basement. After that, it is foolproof to get your ticket and ride up. Hopefully it will be a clear day. Be sure to see the wall display comparing the tower to other towers around the world.

title: OK church for its design
text: Touted as an example of Gothic architecture, it is a letdown. We were expecting more of a French Gothic church but, alas, no. The woodwork is notable but not outstanding. Stop to see if you are nearby but do not make a special trip.

title: Interesting walk.
text: By far the busiest walking street in Aukland, you can see all the top stores and stroll about for people watching. Located on a slope up from the water so if you cannot walk uphill easily, take a bus up to the Quest Hotel about the 300 block address and walk down to the water, about 1.5 kms.

title: Good airline, average service
text: Flight was on time both ways. Standard narrow seat for economy class. Food was mostly inedible. When we ask the flight attendant what the dish was, she could not answer. "It's a Wrap", she said. "What's in it? "I don't know," she said.

title: Flights from hell
text: Supposed to be flight from LAX to DTW with stopover in Phoenix BUT a snow storm in Detroit cancelled all flights from LAX to DTW. In their wisdom, AA flew us to Philadelphia and then to DTW. But DTW was still socked in, so they flew us to Washington D.C., then to DTW. Took 3 days, 2 extra nights, lousy food and serious jet lag (coming from New Zealand). Second worse experience from AA. The first was a flight from Chile where the flight crew argued, yelled and screamed at each other.

title: Nice room, Walking marathon to get there
text: Stayed in a tower on 22nd floor. To get there from the registration, had to use 2 elevators and walk about 1/4 mile. To get to the front entrance from the room, had to walk almost a 3/4 mile. Room was very nice and quiet but downstairs at the entertainment and gaming level, there were tons of running noisy kids. While this is probably the only family casino/hotel in Vegas,the crowds are something to deal with on weekends. The buffet was just average for that city. Some other food options are limited and a bit pricey, but that is Las Vegas.
place: Circus Circus Hotel & Casino Las Vegas

title: Nice day trip
text: Nice rock formations and well organized for car travel or some short hiking. Easy to drive to from Las Vegas. It is a National Park, so you need a pass.
place: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area

title: Glitter and Eye candy
text: The drive from the airport to downtown is a visual treat if you can be patient with the traffic. Also drive it at night for the lights.

title: Nice day trip
text: The dam is one of the wonders of the West and you should see it once in your life. The amount and work and lives given to build it is amazing when you see the size of it. At this time the water is very low from the drought and you can appreciate the water shortage when you see the low water marker against the normal level.

title: Average Buffet
text: The buffet does offer about 100 dishes, but some are canned, pastries are bought and the room is laid out for volume rather than quality. Some foods are good, made to order and others lacking.

title: Great food and service
text: Been going to this restraurant since it opened in the early 70s. Still big portions and good variety. Located across from the Circus Circus, it makes a great alternative from Circus food. Many business people eat there as well.

title: Can't Miss Treat
text: This is one attraction you cannot miss. The overhead video enclosed the main portion of Fremont Street with videos and music. The casino lights dim and the spectacle begins. Also try the Zip line that runs the length of it.

title: Great Stay, beautiful scenery
text: This was a 3 day stay as part of the fly package from Air Tahiti Nui, so we did not expect much but were pleasantly surprised. This is a closed resort with all the landscaping, giant pool, restaurants, beach and service you would expect from a resort hotel. Our only hiccup was that they placed the packages deals off to the side of the resort building and not that convenient to the main activities. The view out our door, for instance, was a shipping container, but the view out the sliding door was a giant bush, blocking all view of the grounds. Breakfast buffet was 100+ items and excellent. Dinner and other food was expensive for our tastes but, hey, it's a resort.
place: Tahiti Ia Ora Beach Resort managed by Sofitel

title: Great food, atmosphere
text: As always for this restaurant, the service was good the food tasty and the pies are a can't miss. Located in front of several hotels.

title: Room OK, skip breakfast
text: The room is average for Day's Inn chain. However we stayed 3 days and on the second day, housekeeping opened the cutains for all to see out luggage and belongs. Was pretty upset to see when we return in the evening. Breakfast consists of sweet rolls, cereal and typical continental items with the requisite waffle. Very convenient to the Ohio State fairgrounds, next door. Not convenient to any restaurant except McDonald's across the parking lot.
place: Days Inn by Wyndham Columbus Fairgrounds

title: good hotel
text: Recently rebuilt from a tornado strike, the hotel is in excellent condition with a clean and very attentive breakfast staff. 7-8 minutes from downtown Birmingham via expressways. Many restaurants within 1-2 miles. Hot breakfast with typical sides.

title: Below average BBQ Ribs
text: Had the BBQ baby back ribs. Tough, did not pull from bone. Typical of cooking too hot and fast. Very little smoke ring. Pulled pork was very good. Loaded baked potato, about the size of a football, enough for 2 people.

title: Big Burger
text: First time at a Whataburger, Big burgers were tasty enough. Lettuce was old with brown edges. Large fast food menu and breakfast.

title: Average food
text: THe famed Tony Packo's extolled by Jamie Farr on M*A*S*H and signed hot dog buns by every person of note imaginable, has just average food. The Hungarian hot dog is the best item, but the Mac and Cheese was strange in that it uses Spatzle instead of macaroni. The roast beef had a good flavor but was drowned in what tasted like canned gravy. We live about 6 mies from the place but this was the first time in over 10 years we visited. Some food a bit pricey, but you pay for the atmosphere.

title: Average Chinese food
text: Dishes change in taste and presentation from time to time. Best value are the combo meals at the back of the menu. Include an egg roll, main dish and fried rice. Fast takeout.

title: Great breakfasts
text: Has great breakfast compos but pricing depends on the time of day. Strange, but that way for years.Breakfast compos cannot be beat for the price. Owner recently sold the entire property to a grocery chain, so not sure how long it will be open. Open 24hrs. Good stop on way to Cedar Point amusement park and Lake Erie fishing.

title: Good but not excellent BBQ
text: The ribs had a dry rub but little smoke flavor. No smoke ring on meat to speak of. The pulled pork was excellent as was the corn bread. Sides were average. Service was so-so. Did not check for drink refills, had to flag down the waitress.

title: Living off reputation
text: Ordered a corned beef ($20.25). It had the looks and texture of being sliced several hours before, placed in a steam pan and set in a steam table uncovered. The meat had a hard, dried out crust, tough and many pieces were overly fatty. A Philly Steak sandwich was fine ($20.25). A egg salad sandwich had a good flavor ($27.75). I think they are cruising on a past good reputation but not paying attention to food quality as in the past.

title: Best view in NYC
text: Fantastic view of the city and Central park. Cost is outrageous at $35+ per person. The last 2 floors are steps only to get to the open air. There is an enclosed view floor with the elevator.

title: Good example of Gothic architecture
text: The church was just cleaned, maybe over cleaned, but looked great. If you have studied French Gothic Cathedrals, you will appreciate this one.

title: Nice room and facility
text: Although we reserved the Eisenhower Hotel, it is actually connected to another hotel, the Aspire. Check in is there. Our rooms were there. Very spacious and high quality. Dunno if the Eisenhower is still used or only for overflow. The free dinner, well,... Frozen corn, instant potatoes and those frozen, pre prepared chicken cordon bleu bricks you get at the grocery to reheat at home. The breakfast was great and top notch. The hotel is 4 miles or so from the city and less than that to the battlefield visitors center. Nice grounds and area.

title: Nice Hotel but money grab
text: Hotel right on the Sun Moon Lake with an excellent view on the lake side. Room was very nice, breakfast OK with mostly Chinese selections.. Very Expensive for the night. Valet parking. Has a free boat tour early in the morning.

title: Average tourist desination
text: The lake itself is unique to the country, so that's why it is popular, but no better than a scenic lake anywhere.

title: Breathtaking Mountain sights
text:
The gorge itself is spectacular mountain scenery, usually over crowded with tour buses.
Cross mountain highways leading from Daxi or from the south have equally great sights of rivers, passes and gorges. If you enjoy driving hairpin turns and spectacular heights, the is for you. Most go to the Gorge for the many hiking trails but driving is a great experience itself.

title: Marker for Tropic of Cancer
text: If you are driving by, it is good for a photo and a snack from the many food stands. Don't go out of your way.

title: Right place, Right Price, Right Quality
text: Scoured the hotel sights for days for Taipei and settled on Hotel 73. Turned out it was centrally located, 4 minutes from the subway and next door to a local market with a 7-11 a few yards away. Nice room, nice breakfast and wonderful staff that was very helpful, courteous and spoke very good English.

title: Clean, covers the entire city and some suburbs
text: Clean and efficient. Experienced very courteous folks who offered seats every time we rode it. ( we are 73+). Some offered help with directions and sights. Use the credit card for easy pay and unused funds can be refunded. Has escalator and elevator access.

title: Nice temple to see next to MRT station and local street sights.
text: Visited on Chinese New Years Day and was amazed at the crowds. This is a central temple with lots of traffic.

title: Taopei from on high
text: Go up the fastest elevator you will ever ride and the sprawling city and architecture from above. Great sight.

title: Beautiful Temple
text: This temple is a small complex about 8 minute walk from the MRT. Well worth the MRT trip and is out of the central city for a quiet time.
